page.title: 06Amenities in the Villages.
page.content: Ashton has a general village shop and Post Office and a village hall.It also has a small school which has been under threat of closing for some time.Roade is only on the edge of our area so is dealt with elsewhere.Hartwell has a Post Office and general shop,a school of 180,a Parish Hall,playing field and is close to Salcey Forest for country interests.Ashton has decided to build more expensive houses and generally has fewer problems from the lack of playing field space and social activities than Hartwell.It has a strong rugby union & cricket club which also houses many other activities.Hartwell has grown to be the much larger village but has not much to offer its new residents by way of things to do.There is no feeling of belonging or responsibility for the village. Chad Shakespeare,11.
